meta.headline: Daily Show: This Just In
meta.subhead: Keep your finger on the fake pulse.

element.title: Daily Show: Writers Are Back
element.description: The writers are back -- it's like Christmas morning for Jon.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Moment of Zen – Rove’s Map
element.description: Karl Rove’s hand drawn map of the Virginia primary.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Potomac Primaries
element.description: Huckabee needs miracle and Hillary needs some IT support.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Black History Month
element.description: Larry Wilmore thanks Black History Month for Obama’s success.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Torture Talk – CIA Tapes
element.description: Sen. Arlen Specter explains why destroyed CIA tapes are not worth investigating, but NFL video tapes are.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Mark Siegel
element.description: Mark Siegel and Benazir Bhutto finished her book seven days before she was assassinated.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert – Coffee Strike
element.description: Stephen is upset by the coffee-getters union strike.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Real Action Heroes
element.description: Jon discovers Mike Huckabee is a real guy and runs down career highlights from Chuck Norris.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Man of Faith
element.description: Jon wonders why the media harps on Mike Huckabee's Christian beliefs and debunks conspiracy theories of the governor's religious messages.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Back to Work
element.description: Rob Riggle hails the return of the striking writers, but predicts only bad things for The Daily Show's host.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Headlines - In Charm's Way
element.description: MIT's new charm school aims to teach their students how to conceal their boners while in Radio Shack.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

meta.headline: Daily Show/Colbert Report: Crossing Over
meta.subhead: When Jon hands the baton to Stephen, anything can happen.

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Cry Baby
element.description: Stephen is upset by the sound of a crying baby in his studio audience.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - She-male Emmy
element.description: Stephen won't drop his halter-top plans to present an Emmy for Best She-Male in a comedy series.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Donzi ZR
element.description: Stephen spent last weekend riding up and down the coast in his new speedboat.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Vacation
element.description: Stephen needs a vacation too.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Silent Blunder
element.description: Not to be outdone, Stephen is doing his show from Afghanistan this week.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - YouTube Trial
element.description: Stephen prepares Jon for his upcoming deposition for the YouTube lawsuit.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Rove
element.description: Karl Rove has a new job with the Colbert Report starting September 1.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Anagrams
element.description: Stephen creates anagrams using the presidential candidates’ (and hosts') names.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Epic Poem
element.description: Stephen wrote a Homeric epic poem for tonight's toss.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Sonnet
element.description: Stephen recites a sonnet about his upcoming show.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Cottlesworth
element.description: Stephen apologizes to Josephus Cottlesworth for flubbing his well-crafted tosses to Jon.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - So Close
element.description: Stephen almost makes it to the end of his regular Daily Show check-in.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Daily Show: Daily/Colbert - Billy Goes Potty
element.description: Stephen has some encouraging words for Billy after he made a pee-pee.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Potomassacre
element.description: Barack Obama wins with a message of hope - Stephen hopes he can get through the script.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Writers Strike Over
element.description: Stephen personally welcomes back each of his writers.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: David Gracer
element.description: David Gracer cooks up a delicious plate of insects and invites Stephen join in the feast.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Fallback Position-Astrophysicist
element.description: Stephen visits Neil deGrasse Tyson to learn how to be an astrophysicist.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Richard Thompson Ford
element.description: Richard Thompson Ford believes the Clintons are playing the race card against Obama.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Huckabee's Obligation
element.description: Mike Huckabee says he is obligated to pick Stephen as his running mate.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Gov. Eliot Spitzer
element.description: Governor Eliot Spitzer is a superdelegate and agrees to help Stephen become a superdelegate too.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Rep. Eleanor Holmes Norton
element.description: Superdelegate Eleanor Holmes Norton tells Stephen that the days of smoke-filled rooms are over.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Interview - Lisa Randall
element.description: Lisa Randall tells Stephen that there are other dimensions that have never even heard of him.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Obama Wins a Grammy
element.description: Barack Obama won a Grammy -- essential hardware for a candidate these days.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Goodbye Mitt
element.description: Stephen bids farewell to Mitt Romney's presidential campaign.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Aubrey de Grey
element.description: Professor Aubrey de Grey researches a way to make John McCain younger.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Portrait Check-In
element.description: Stephen checks in with Marc Pachter of the National Portrait Gallery to see how his portrait is doing.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report: Interview - Philip Zimbardo
element.description: Stephen gives Philip Zimbardo a lesson on heaven, hell and Lucifer.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report Recap - Week of 2/4/08
element.description: Highlights from the world of Stephen and his guests.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

meta.headline: Colbert Report: The Word

element.title: Colbert Report: The Word: (...)
element.description: Stephen looks back on his strong anti-union history.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report - Job Description
element.description: Stephen makes it clear that he is not running for president -- he is running for President Bush.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report - Absinthetinence
element.description: Stephen asks the youth of America to join him in taking the Absinthe Abstinence Pledge.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report - Enviro-medal Disaster
element.description: Al Gore isn’t the only one that deserves an award. Don’t our children deserve a few?
element.author: ComedyCentral.com

element.title: Colbert Report - Americon Dream
element.description: To achieve an ordered society, we have to eliminate the root cause of crime -- all the people.
element.author: ComedyCentral.com
